meanings.definition: The study of geometric properties and spatial relations unaffected by the continuous change of shape or size.
meanings.sent1: In my topology class, we learn about shapes and how they relate to each other.
meanings.sent2: The professor explained the topology of the shapes in a simple and clear manner.
meanings.sent3: I find it amusing how the topology of these shapes stays the same no matter how much they stretch.
meanings.sent4: The topology of the geometric figures remained constant even as they morphed into different forms.
meanings.sent5: The topology of the shapes is like a hidden code waiting to be deciphered.

meanings.definition: The way in which constituent parts are interrelated or arranged.
meanings.sent1: The topology of the organization's departments determines how they work together.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the topology of the network helps in troubleshooting connectivity issues.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing to see how the office's topology affects the flow of communication.
meanings.sent4: The topology of the team's structure resembled a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The topology of the puzzle pieces revealed the hidden image when put together correctly.
